description: IBMVPCCluster is the Schema for the ibmvpcclusters API.

apiVersion.description:
APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object.
Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and
may reject unrecognized values.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description:
Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents.
Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to.
Cannot be updated.
In CamelCase.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: IBMVPCClusterSpec defines the desired state of IBMVPCCluster.

controlPlaneEndpoint.description: ControlPlaneEndpoint represents the endpoint used to communicate with the control plane.

host.description: host is the hostname on which the API server is serving.

port.description: port is the port on which the API server is serving.

controlPlaneLoadBalancer.description:
ControlPlaneLoadBalancer is optional configuration for customizing control plane behavior.
Use this for legacy support, use Network.LoadBalancers for the extended VPC support.

additionalListeners.description: AdditionalListeners sets the additional listeners for the control plane load balancer.

items.description:
AdditionalListenerSpec defines the desired state of an
additional listener on an VPC load balancer.

defaultPoolName.description: defaultPoolName defines the name of a VPC Load Balancer Backend Pool to use for the VPC Load Balancer Listener.

port.description: Port sets the port for the additional listener.

protocol.description:
protocol defines the protocol to use for the VPC Load Balancer Listener.
Will default to TCP protocol if not specified.

selector.description:
The selector is used to find IBMPowerVSMachines with matching labels.
If the label matches, the machine is then added to the load balancer listener configuration.

matchExpressions.description: matchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

items.description:
A label selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that
relates the key and values.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description:
operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values.
Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

values.description:
values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn,
the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist,
the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic
merge patch.

matchLabels.description:
matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels
map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the
operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

backendPools.description: backendPools defines the load balancer's backend pools.

items.description: VPCLoadBalancerBackendPoolSpec defines the desired configuration of a VPC Load Balancer Backend Pool.

algorithm.description: algorithm defines the load balancing algorithm to use.

healthMonitor.description: healthMonitor defines the backend pool's health monitor.

delay.description: delay defines the seconds to wait between health checks.

port.description: port defines the port to perform health monitoring on.

retries.description: retries defines the max retries for health check.

timeout.description: timeout defines the seconds to wait for a health check response.

type.description: type defines the protocol used for health checks.

urlPath.description: urlPath defines the URL to use for health monitoring.

name.description: name defines the name of the Backend Pool.

protocol.description: protocol defines the protocol to use for the Backend Pool.

name.description: Name sets the name of the VPC load balancer.

public.description: public indicates that load balancer is public or private

securityGroups.description:
securityGroups defines the Security Groups to attach to the load balancer.
Security Groups defined here are expected to already exist when the load balancer is reconciled (these do not get created when reconciling the load balancer).

name.description: name of the resource.

x-kubernetes-validations.message: an id or name must be provided

subnets.description:
subnets defines the VPC Subnets to attach to the load balancer.
Subnets defiens here are expected to already exist when the load balancer is reconciled (these do not get created when reconciling the load balancer).

name.description: name of the resource.

x-kubernetes-validations.message: an id or name must be provided

image.description: image represents the Image details used for the cluster.

cosBucket.description: cosBucket is the name of the IBM Cloud COS Bucket containing the source of the image, if necessary.

cosBucketRegion.description: cosBucketRegion is the COS region the bucket is in.

cosInstance.description: cosInstance is the name of the IBM Cloud COS Instance containing the source of the image, if necessary.

cosObject.description: cosObject is the name of a IBM Cloud COS Object used as the source of the image, if necessary.

crn.description: crn is the IBM Cloud CRN of the existing VPC Custom Image.

name.description: name is the name of the desired VPC Custom Image.

operatingSystem.description: operatingSystem is the Custom Image's Operating System name.

resourceGroup.description: resourceGroup is the Resource Group to create the Custom Image in.

id.description: id defines the IBM Cloud Resource ID.

name.description: name defines the IBM Cloud Resource Name.

x-kubernetes-validations.message: if any of cosInstance, cosBucket, or cosObject are specified, all must be specified
an existing image name or crn must be provided, or to create a new image the cos resources must be provided, with or without a name

network.description: network represents the VPC network to use for the cluster.

controlPlaneSubnets.description: controlPlaneSubnets is a set of Subnet's which define the Control Plane subnets.

loadBalancers.description: loadBalancers is a set of VPC Load Balancer definitions to use for the cluster.

items.description: VPCLoadBalancerSpec defines the desired state of an VPC load balancer.

additionalListeners.description: AdditionalListeners sets the additional listeners for the control plane load balancer.

items.description:
AdditionalListenerSpec defines the desired state of an
additional listener on an VPC load balancer.

defaultPoolName.description: defaultPoolName defines the name of a VPC Load Balancer Backend Pool to use for the VPC Load Balancer Listener.

port.description: Port sets the port for the additional listener.

protocol defines the protocol to use for the VPC Load Balancer Listener.
Will default to TCP protocol if not specified.

name.description: name of the resource.

subnets defines the VPC Subnets to attach to the load balancer.
Subnets defiens here are expected to already exist when the load balancer is reconciled (these do not get created when reconciling the load balancer).

name.description: name of the resource.

resourceGroup.description:
resourceGroup is the Resource Group containing all of the newtork resources.
This can be different than the Resource Group containing the remaining cluster resources.

id.description: id defines the IBM Cloud Resource ID.

name.description: name defines the IBM Cloud Resource Name.

securityGroups.description: securityGroups is a set of VPCSecurityGroup's which define the VPC Security Groups that manage traffic within and out of the VPC.

items.description: VPCSecurityGroup defines a VPC Security Group that should exist or be created within the specified VPC, with the specified Security Group Rules.

name.description: name of the Security Group.

rules.description: rules are the Security Group Rules for the Security Group.

items.description: VPCSecurityGroupRule defines a VPC Security Group Rule for a specified Security Group.

action.description: action defines whether to allow or deny traffic defined by the Security Group Rule.

destination.description:
destination is a VPCSecurityGroupRulePrototype which defines the destination of outbound traffic for the Security Group Rule.
Only used when direction is VPCSecurityGroupRuleDirectionOutbound.

icmpCode.description:
icmpCode is the ICMP code for the Rule.
Only used when Protocol is VPCSecurityGroupRuleProtocolIcmp.

icmpType.description:
icmpType is the ICMP type for the Rule.
Only used when Protocol is VPCSecurityGroupRuleProtocolIcmp.

portRange.description: portRange is a range of ports allowed for the Rule's remote.

maximumPort.description: maximumPort is the inclusive upper range of ports.

minimumPort.description: minimumPort is the inclusive lower range of ports.

x-kubernetes-validations.message: maximum port must be greater than or equal to minimum port

protocol.description: protocol defines the traffic protocol used for the Security Group Rule.

remotes.description:
remotes is a set of VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemote's that define the traffic allowed by the Rule's remote.
Specifying multiple VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemote's creates a unique Security Group Rule with the shared Protocol, PortRange, etc.
This allows for easier management of Security Group Rule's for sets of CIDR's, IP's, etc.

items.description:
VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemote defines a VPC Security Group Rule's remote details.
The type of remote defines the additional remote details where are used for defining the remote.

address.description:
address is the address to use for the remote's destination/source.
Only used when remoteType is VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemoteTypeAddress.

cidrSubnetName.description:
cidrSubnetName is the name of the VPC Subnet to retrieve the CIDR from, to use for the remote's destination/source.
Only used when remoteType is VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemoteTypeCIDR.

remoteType.description: remoteType defines the type of filter to define for the remote's destination/source.

securityGroupName.description:
securityGroupName is the name of the VPC Security Group to use for the remote's destination/source.
Only used when remoteType is VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemoteTypeSG

x-kubernetes-validations.message: cidrSubnetName, addresss, and securityGroupName are not valid for VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemoteTypeAny remoteType
only cidrSubnetName is valid for VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemoteTypeCIDR remoteType
only address is valid for VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemoteTypeIP remoteType
only securityGroupName is valid for VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemoteTypeSG remoteType
icmpCode and icmpType are only supported for VPCSecurityGroupRuleProtocolIcmp protocol
portRange is not valid for VPCSecurityGroupRuleProtocolAll protocol
portRange is not valid for VPCSecurityGroupRuleProtocolIcmp protocol

direction.description: direction defines whether the traffic is inbound or outbound for the Security Group Rule.

securityGroupID.description: securityGroupID is the ID of the Security Group for the Security Group Rule.

source.description:
source is a VPCSecurityGroupRulePrototype which defines the source of inbound traffic for the Security Group Rule.
Only used when direction is VPCSecurityGroupRuleDirectionInbound.

icmpCode.description:
icmpCode is the ICMP code for the Rule.
Only used when Protocol is VPCSecurityGroupRuleProtocolIcmp.

icmpType.description:
icmpType is the ICMP type for the Rule.
Only used when Protocol is VPCSecurityGroupRuleProtocolIcmp.

portRange.description: portRange is a range of ports allowed for the Rule's remote.

maximumPort.description: maximumPort is the inclusive upper range of ports.

minimumPort.description: minimumPort is the inclusive lower range of ports.

x-kubernetes-validations.message: maximum port must be greater than or equal to minimum port

protocol.description: protocol defines the traffic protocol used for the Security Group Rule.

remotes.description:
remotes is a set of VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemote's that define the traffic allowed by the Rule's remote.
Specifying multiple VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemote's creates a unique Security Group Rule with the shared Protocol, PortRange, etc.
This allows for easier management of Security Group Rule's for sets of CIDR's, IP's, etc.

items.description:
VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemote defines a VPC Security Group Rule's remote details.
The type of remote defines the additional remote details where are used for defining the remote.

address.description:
address is the address to use for the remote's destination/source.
Only used when remoteType is VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemoteTypeAddress.

cidrSubnetName.description:
cidrSubnetName is the name of the VPC Subnet to retrieve the CIDR from, to use for the remote's destination/source.
Only used when remoteType is VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemoteTypeCIDR.

remoteType.description: remoteType defines the type of filter to define for the remote's destination/source.

securityGroupName.description:
securityGroupName is the name of the VPC Security Group to use for the remote's destination/source.
Only used when remoteType is VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemoteTypeSG

x-kubernetes-validations.message: cidrSubnetName, addresss, and securityGroupName are not valid for VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemoteTypeAny remoteType
only cidrSubnetName is valid for VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemoteTypeCIDR remoteType
only address is valid for VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemoteTypeIP remoteType
only securityGroupName is valid for VPCSecurityGroupRuleRemoteTypeSG remoteType
icmpCode and icmpType are only supported for VPCSecurityGroupRuleProtocolIcmp protocol
portRange is not valid for VPCSecurityGroupRuleProtocolAll protocol
portRange is not valid for VPCSecurityGroupRuleProtocolIcmp protocol
both destination and source cannot be provided
source must be set for VPCSecurityGroupRuleDirectionInbound direction
destination is not valid for VPCSecurityGroupRuleDirectionInbound direction
destination must be set for VPCSecurityGroupRuleDirectionOutbound direction
source is not valid for VPCSecurityGroupRuleDirectionOutbound direction

tags.description: tags are tags to add to the Security Group.

x-kubernetes-validations.message: either an id or name must be specified

vpc.description: vpc defines the IBM Cloud VPC for extended VPC Infrastructure support.

name.description: name of the resource.

x-kubernetes-validations.message: an id or name must be provided

workerSubnets.description: workerSubnets is a set of Subnet's which define the Worker subnets.

region.description: The IBM Cloud Region the cluster lives in.

resourceGroup.description: The VPC resources should be created under the resource group.

status.description: IBMVPCClusterStatus defines the observed state of IBMVPCCluster.

conditions.description: Conditions defines current service state of the load balancer.

items.description: Condition defines an observation of a Cluster API resource operational state.

lastTransitionTime.description:
lastTransitionTime is the last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.
This should be when the underlying condition changed. If that is not known, then using the time when
the API field changed is acceptable.

message.description:
message is a human readable message indicating details about the transition.
This field may be empty.

reason.description:
reason is the reason for the condition's last transition in CamelCase.
The specific API may choose whether or not this field is considered a guaranteed API.
This field may be empty.

severity.description:
severity provides an explicit classification of Reason code, so the users or machines can immediately
understand the current situation and act accordingly.
The Severity field MUST be set only when Status=False.

status.description: status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

type.description:
type of condition in CamelCase or in foo.example.com/CamelCase.
Many .condition.type values are consistent across resources like Available, but because arbitrary conditions
can be useful (see .node.status.conditions), the ability to deconflict is important.

controlPlaneLoadBalancerState.description: ControlPlaneLoadBalancerState is the status of the load balancer.

image.description: image is the status of the VPC Custom Image.

id.description: id defines the Id of the IBM Cloud resource status.

name.description: name defines the name of the IBM Cloud resource status.

ready.description: ready defines whether the IBM Cloud resource is ready.

network.description: network is the status of the VPC network resources for extended VPC Infrastructure support.

controlPlaneSubnets.description:
controlPlaneSubnets references the VPC Subnets for the cluster's Control Plane.
The map simplifies lookups.

additionalProperties.description: ResourceStatus identifies a resource by id (and name) and whether it is ready.

id.description: id defines the Id of the IBM Cloud resource status.

name.description: name defines the name of the IBM Cloud resource status.

ready.description: ready defines whether the IBM Cloud resource is ready.

loadBalancers.description:
loadBalancers references the VPC Load Balancer's for the cluster.
The map simplifies lookups.

additionalProperties.description: VPCLoadBalancerStatus defines the status VPC load balancer.

controllerCreated.description: controllerCreated indicates whether the resource is created by the controller.

hostname.description: hostname is the hostname of load balancer.

state.description: State is the status of the load balancer.

publicGateways.description:
publicGateways references the VPC Public Gateways for the cluster.
The map simplifies lookups.

additionalProperties.description: ResourceStatus identifies a resource by id (and name) and whether it is ready.

id.description: id defines the Id of the IBM Cloud resource status.

name.description: name defines the name of the IBM Cloud resource status.

ready.description: ready defines whether the IBM Cloud resource is ready.

resourceGroup.description:
resourceGroup references the Resource Group for Network resources for the cluster.
This can be the same or unique from the cluster's Resource Group.

name.description: name defines the name of the IBM Cloud resource status.

ready.description: ready defines whether the IBM Cloud resource is ready.

securityGroups.description:
securityGroups references the VPC Security Groups for the cluster.
The map simplifies lookups.

additionalProperties.description: ResourceStatus identifies a resource by id (and name) and whether it is ready.

id.description: id defines the Id of the IBM Cloud resource status.

name.description: name defines the name of the IBM Cloud resource status.

ready.description: ready defines whether the IBM Cloud resource is ready.

vpc.description: vpc references the status of the IBM Cloud VPC as part of the extended VPC Infrastructure support.

id.description: id defines the Id of the IBM Cloud resource status.

name.description: name defines the name of the IBM Cloud resource status.

ready.description: ready defines whether the IBM Cloud resource is ready.

workerSubnets.description:
workerSubnets references the VPC Subnets for the cluster's Data Plane.
The map simplifies lookups.

additionalProperties.description: ResourceStatus identifies a resource by id (and name) and whether it is ready.

id.description: id defines the Id of the IBM Cloud resource status.

name.description: name defines the name of the IBM Cloud resource status.

ready.description: ready defines whether the IBM Cloud resource is ready.
Ready is true when the provider resource is ready.

resourceGroup.description: resourceGroup is the status of the cluster's Resource Group for extended VPC Infrastructure support.

id.description: id defines the Id of the IBM Cloud resource status.

name.description: name defines the name of the IBM Cloud resource status.

ready.description: ready defines whether the IBM Cloud resource is ready.

v1beta2.description: V1beta2 groups all the fields that will be added or modified in IBMVPCCluster's status with the V1Beta2 version.

conditions.description: Conditions represents the observations of a IBMVPCCluster's current state.

items.description: Condition contains details for one aspect of the current state of this API Resource.

lastTransitionTime.description:
lastTransitionTime is the last time the condition transitioned from one status to another.
This should be when the underlying condition changed.  If that is not known, then using the time when the API field changed is acceptable.

message.description:
message is a human readable message indicating details about the transition.
This may be an empty string.

observedGeneration.description:
observedGeneration represents the .metadata.generation that the condition was set based upon.
For instance, if .metadata.generation is currently 12, but the .status.conditions[x].observedGeneration is 9, the condition is out of date
with respect to the current state of the instance.

reason.description:
reason contains a programmatic identifier indicating the reason for the condition's last transition.
Producers of specific condition types may define expected values and meanings for this field,
and whether the values are considered a guaranteed API.
The value should be a CamelCase string.
This field may not be empty.

status.description: status of the condition, one of True, False, Unknown.

type.description: type of condition in CamelCase or in foo.example.com/CamelCase.

Important: Run "make" to regenerate code after modifying this file
dep: rely on Network instead.

floatingIPID.description: Deprecated: This field has no function and is going to be removed in the next release.
